ygData.subject: RE: possible big cheat for EQ....
ygData.msgSnippet: ... You can move your mouse over to the other screen but ONLY if you adjust your settings under control panel - desktop - monitor. Then adjust your settings
ygData.messageBody:
>From: "Vegue, Tony 1047" <tonyv@...>
>
>Nope, I have a Riva TNT and a matrox Mystique. When I enable both monitors
>and play EQ, the second monitor is disabled for Alt-Tabs and such.
>However,
>if you move a program like Clock over to the second display, BEFORE you
>start EQ, it does stay there during game play. But programs liek ICQ
>return
>to the system tray on the primary display, and you can't see anything.
>
>You also can't move your mouse to the second display. Depending of which
>way to set your screen to stretch, you can't move beyond the boundaries of
>the game during play.
>

You can move your mouse over to the other screen but ONLY if you adjust your
settings under control panel - desktop - monitor. Then adjust your settings
for your desktop area. I had mine set to 2048 x 768 when I had 2 monitors
and 2 cards in, and you should be able to use both monitors. I know it works
with Win NT, (I use it at work with the same settings) for drafting.
